SENT.plain: Pseudohypoparathyroidism (PHP) is a rare disorder characterized by varying degrees of unresponsiveness to parathyroid hormone
Patients usually present with hypocalcemia-induced seizures or tetany, whereas no case of hypocalcemia-induced cardiac arrhythmia in PHP has been described to date

In this paper, we report the case of a male adolescent with PHP type 1a who presented with hypocalcemia-induced ventricular extrasystoles (bigeminy, trigeminy) and mild corrected QT interval prolongation
The patient had brachydactyly and his second fingers and toes were longer than the others, a finding consistent with PHP
Laboratory tests detected hypomagnesemia, as well as elevated levels of creatine kinase and lactate dehydrogenase
Ventricular arrhythmia and abnormal laboratory tests improved with calcium supplementation and vitamin D treatment

The findings in this patient suggest that hypomagnesemia may make patients with PHP more susceptible to hypocalcemia and may thus prompt a state of hypocalcemia-induced arrhythmia or other cardiac complications
